results.title: Teaching a language structure by the Australian situational method. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Ian Hart, John Morris and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the teaching of English by the situational method, including presentation, rhythm and intonation, individual testing and fluency drilling.

results.title: Teachers of the world. Part 2
results.brief_description: Globalisation of information, new technologies, the changing nature of our lives, are factors forcing educators everywhere to face an unprecedented period of reassessment. The teachers in this video are meeting this challenge head-on. “Korea” : a teacher uses drawings and cartoons to teach geometry. “United States of America” : an history teacher creates an experimental learning situation to foster an understanding of social injustice in her students. “Poland” : a teacher has his students exploring tradition and cultural taboo in relation to change and compromise.

results.title: Teachers of the world. Part 1
results.brief_description: Globalisation of information, new technologies, the changing nature of our lives and our work, are factors forcing educators everywhere to face an unprecedented period of reassessment. The teachers in this video are meeting the challenge head-on. “Australia”: Stephanie Lawrence, a teacher from Devonport, Tasmania, uses self actualisation techniques to develop her students self-esteem. “Japan”: Shigeto Honda, a teacher from Ichikawa City near Tokyo, teaches his students about the diversities of Asian cultures by experiencing first hand. “Canada and Finland”: Pekka Hynninen from Rantasalmi in rural Finland takes his students on a hike and boat trip for a scientific environmental study. The class of Rachel Hunneault from Northern Ontario participates in an interactive Telecommunications Network.

results.title: Teachers and pupils talking
results.creator_credit: David Seligman, British Broadcasting Corporation and Open University
results.brief_description: Examines the potential conflict between the teacher’s effort to control the shaping of knowledge in the classroom and the pupils’ attempts to join the shaping. Several of the strategies adopted by the teacher are noted.

results.title: Teacher, take us orienteering
results.brief_description:
A teacher is shown with a group of older primary school students outlining the principles of orienteering and putting these into practice.
Suitable for teacher training level.

results.title: Teacher and technology
results.creator_credit: Milton Ingerson, South Australian Film Corporation and U-Tel
results.brief_description: Aims to promote technology awarness in teachers. Changes in needs and methods have led to a greater use of technology in the classroom, especially for self-paced learning. The practical applications of equipment are discussed. Children from four South Australian primary schools participated in the production. Essentially a promotion of the South Australian Educational Technology Centre. It emphasizes the need to teach using 1980s technology. Hardware covered includes over-head projectors, computers, video, film.

results.title: Teach me what?
results.creator_credit: David E. Barrow, Peter Johnson, Camfilm Productions and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Shows the Army Apprentices School as an institution that trains boys for a career in the Army as tradesmen. Includes a variety of trades open to young men, and shows extra-curricular activities and the opportunity for sport. The story endeavours to humanise the Army and to dispel some preconceptions.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Teach me to dance
results.creator_credit: Anne Wheeler, Vladimir Valenta and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Lesia convinces her English-Canadian friend Sarah to perform a Ukrainian dance with her as part of their school’s Christmas pageant. However, Sarah’s father objects. Angry at the growing number of Ukrainian settlers, he will not allow his daughter to do the Ukrainian dance with Lesia. But in spite of the prejudices of their parents, the girls’ friendship remains strong, and they meet in Sarah’s barn to celebrate Christmas Day together. Award: Milan. Story and screenplay by Myrna Kostash. Suitable for upper primary and middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Teach me how I can do it myself: the Montessori Method in the Netherlands (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Theo Van Haren Noman, Jack Apon and Nederlandse Onderwijs Film
results.brief_description: Dr. Maria Montessori’s original contribution to the psychology of education has left a mark on present day schooling throughout the world. This film aims to give an impression of the methods she worked out for infant and primary school, based upon the child’s genuine needs.
results.title_for_label: Teach me how I can do it myself: the Montessori Method in the Netherlands (TEFC)

results.title: Tea with Mussolini
results.creator_credit: Franco Zeffirelli, Clive Parsons, Giovanella Zannoni, Riccardo Tozzi, G2, Cineritmo, Cattleya, Medusa Film and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Loosely based on his childhood, Zeffirelli weaves this enchanting tale with a gentle, loving hand. It is the story of a diverse group of cultured ladies, living in Florence in 1934, who meet for tea each afternoon. The group includes Lady Random (Maggie Smith), widow of the British ambassador to Italy, Arabella (Judy Dench) an artist and singer, Georgie (Lily Tomlin), an exuberant American archaeologist, and the brash and uninhibited Elsa (Cher). One of the ladies, Mary (Joan Plowright), becomes a surrogate mother to a young boy, Luca, and he is soon virtually adopted and brought up by the group. As Luca grows to become a man, the shifting political climate begins to have a devastating impact on the rarified world in which the ladies exist, and they must come to terms not only with their own mortality but also the inescapable passage of time.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Franco Zeffirelli, Clive Parsons, Giovanella Zannoni, Riccardo Tozzi, G2, Cineritmo, Cattleya, Medusa Film and Universal Pictures
